favourite.article: Thank you so much for this opportunity to sing my heart out, the rest of this week. Thank you.
Everlasting joy!!

Wow, this song came to me today, not surprisingly actually, as I've been having some down moments & this has lifted me! You may wonder where I remember it from, well it was back in the early 80's, at church, where it was a very lively & catchy song. I think I will pass it on to a few others, & see if my folks remember it! The good thing I remember about church songs back in the 80's is, they seem to be directly from the Bible verses, which I feel is amazing! Some songs these days aren't really what you would imagine biblical songs to be like. I know God knows our hearts. God bless to all. <><

I was led by the Lord this morning to Isaiah 35. When I read verse 10 I was struck by a portion of this melody--a song I sang many, many years ago, and not sure even where. I tried many variations of titles on YouTube but couldn't find it, and I checked hymnals and a few web sites. So glad to have found it here! It is such a joyful, God-honoring song, and will be on my lips and in my heart for days, I am sure. By the way, it's precious to read other people's comments, too. May God richly bless each of you brothers and sisters! I will see you one day in Glory!

....everlasting joy shall be upon our head.. I love this song and it's keeping me grow in spirit and in Christ... as I believe as am singing unto Zion.. everlasting joy wont leave me. It's on repeat, my caller tone, my car. I love listening to the tone.

As I was making my way to the hospital to have an MRI on my knees. This song popped into my brain. I wondered why? Before any exams they need to find out about you. I told them I had brain surgery 12 yrs ago. They needed to see the xrays. Well I wasn't getting the MRI because I have a metal clip in my brain. God saves lives. And He saved me again. He's so great.
This is such a powerful song. Psalm 35:10

This song has been the song of my spirit the past couple of days. My bible devotion this morning was on Isaiah 35. The happy future that God promise us. The struggling we are going through now surely can't be compared to the glorious happiness awaiting us believers Praise be to His name. Amen.
This song has just come to mind and I believe it's a declaration for my backslidden son to come back to the Lord. Amen.
Praise the Lord, I've been so much encouraged by this song.

I have recently returned to the Lord and began reading my Bible again. I came across the verse in Isaiah 35:10, it reminded me of this song but I couldn't remember the whole song. Thank God for technology! I googled what I knew and it directed me here. So for the time being, this song will be my anthem!
I have known this song for some year back, my heart is filled with joy of the Lord, each time I sing it.
Praise our Head, Christ! Everlasting joy shall be upon Him!
The joy of the Lord is my strength!
Love this song and can't wait to sing it in Zion above!
I just heard this song a few weeks ago and it is just sooo BEAUTIFUL!! does anyone have the guitar chords/notes for this song?? thanks!
I love this song! Especially when South Auckland SDA Primary school sing it! It's a taste of the heavenly choir...made up of God's little Jewels that have been redeemed ;) God blesses :)
Therefore the redeemed ... a great song sung with spirit and clapping as one celebrates the word of Isaiah 46 :11.
I like this song. I heard it long time back. I just feel I am one of them singing. It's quite inspiring.
Amen Lord Jesus! Your redeemed and regenerated people shall return!
This was written as a prayer for all saints to return to the Zion of their spirit where our triune God dwells as the Spirit. The writer, Ruth.
This song is filled with everlasting joy!:)
